text: Hi everyone, I am creating email engagements, related contact's feed. there is no problem in there but is there any way to create them with reply button to continue communication

Hello everyone,
I have a question here for the creation of custom object, by the documentation the only method allowed is by using the API key.
However in the settings page the website doesn't provide it and tell me to use the new oauth2 key.
As this call is not available on oauth2 I am in a deadlock, do you have leads in how can I get myself out of it ?

I ran into this same issue last week – the documentation isn't updated. You can <https://developers.HubSpot.com/blog/how-to-build-a-custom-object-using-private-apps|create a Custom Object with a private app>
They also just came out with the native Custom Object Builder in the Settings, which you can build right within your portal (albeit with less customization)
thanks <@U0446K6RTGX> you saved me some precious time :slightly_smiling_face:
Hi all, is there a way to associate contacts with custom objects automatically if their email fields match?
You could definitely use a workflow for this
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PU4LV8/p1664872918902219>
with some custom code you think?
Yeah super easy
Let me know if you need help writing the Custom code
awesome thanks, I'll check it out and let you know
cool cool
You can also create custom object with a normal app you just have to apply for a special program
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/custom-objects-schema-pilot>

Hi, can I fetch an API where I can show vacancies from an other platform other then HubSpot? I got an bearer token but I have
```has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. If an opaque response serves your needs, set the request's mode to 'no-cors' to fetch the resource with CORS disabled.```
Hopefully someone can help me/link me an example that would be so helpful, thanks in advance
Are you trying to run that on the front end?
Yes, sort of a blog listing but with vacancies
Yeah you can't do that from the frontend
You would have to pipe that information through from a serverless function
Plus I really don't think you want to expose your api credentials like that by putting them on the frontend
Alright thank you, I will look into how to create the serverless function. I also try to hide the credentials but I guess I can figure that out once I tried to have the function.
Yep so that serverless function will hide your credentials for you

Hello All!

I would like to maintain an Active List of Contacts based on their location (lat/long) radius distance from another location (lat/long).

I didn’t see the query capabilities in the Contact API, and it doesn’t seem like you can store location data on a Contact as a new field,  so I created a HubDB table with a contact_id column and I have a custom workflow that keeps this updated when the address changes.  I have written logic that allows a user to search for all Contacts in our account by distance to an address.  I can take this list of Contacts and create a static list… but I was curious if there was a way to setup a custom Active List filter.  I noticed we already had a few third party integrations that have List filters in an `INTEGRATION FILTERS` category.

Where would I find the api documentation for creating such a filter?  Is there an easier way?

Thank you!

Hey man, just wanted to say thank you for the help. We are up and running. In all the reference docs for HubSpot it looks like you can't pull the HubSpot Users and their names? I can only seem to get their HubSpot User Number.

Aloha! We are a HubSpot+Salesforce stack. We're trying to pass the `label values` for the Source, Source Drill Down 1, & Source Drill Down 2 into Salesforce. Since the native HubSpot <>Salesforce integration only passes `internal values` does anyone know how difficult it would be for a non-developer to create an private app to pass `label values`  into salesforce?

That or find a way to copy label values into a new field within HubSpot.

<@UQWGKUEN7> I saw you helped with a similar problem last year.
